item.title: Australia Awards – M&E Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
As part of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) consolidated Sub-Saharan African Aid program, Australia Awards will be one of three key components. Australia Awards are prestigious international scholarships offered by the Australian Government to the next generation of global leaders. Australia Awards provide opportunities for long-term (Masters) and short course study and professional development, aiming to develop capacity and leadership skills so that individuals can contribute to development in their home country.

Scholarships have been a key part of Australia’s aid program to Africa since the 1960s, providing over 5,000 scholarships across the continent and are an important development and public diplomacy tool in Sub-Saharan Africa. In addition to building critical skills and knowledge, they foster an engaged and influential network of leaders, reformers and advocates driving development across the continent, contributing to Australian economic diplomacy objectives and promoting valuable links between Australia and African countries.

Australia Awards will be comprised of:

  • Australia Awards Scholarships: demand-driven Masters undertaken at Australian universities, to be offered to approximately 11 Sub-Saharan African countries.
  • Australia Awards Africa Short Courses: tailored short (two-three months) post-graduate courses in sectors where Australia has recognised expertise and which are areas of priority to partner governments (agriculture, extractives and public policy). Offered to approximately 22 Sub-Saharan African countries, short course awards will be delivered through Australian registered training organisations, in partnership with African institutions to promote relevance.
  • Australia Award Fellowships: short-term opportunities for study, research and professional attachment in Australia, delivered by Australian organisations. Currently available across Africa to nominated fellows from eligible countries (this will be delivered through a global program external to the AADP).

Australia Awards – M&E Specialist

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Tertiary degree in a relevant discipline
  • Proven communication and negotiation skills and an ability to work in a variety of cultural settings
  • Fluent in English. Proficiency in French and Portuguese will be considered an asset

General Professional Experience:

  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders
  • Proven ability to deliver long-term development programs

Specific Professional Experience:

  • A minimum of 5 years in Monitoring and Evaluation, preferably in the field of tertiary education or scholarships/exchange programs
  • At least 5 years of experience working in Sub-Saharan Africa
  • Previous work with the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) is desirable

Please send your CV to sarah_owen@dai.com. Due to the high number of applicants, if you have not been contacted by the closing date please assume your application has been unsuccessful.

The expert will work for ensuring that Committees and Members have a role and are capacitated to actively participate in budget formulation, mid-year budget reviews and scrutiny of expenditures. The work with the corresponding specialised Secretariat Branches should have as ultimate purpose to ensure stronger internal assembly input for the decision-making and public accounts scrutiny of Committees. The expert should also build mechanisms and pull expertise from think tanks, academia, research and civil society etc, and to make them available on a regular and sustainable basis to the assemblies.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • University degree at Masters' level in social and/or political science, public/business administration, management, economics, law or related discipline or with experience of at least 15 years
  • Excellent leadership, management, communication (written and oral), networking and reporting skills
  • Ability to work at senior parliamentary level; ability to work under pressure and to meet strict deadlines
  • Proficiency in written and oral English language

General Professional Experience:

  • At least ten years professional experience in the field of development and institutional work related to budgetary process and public accounts' oversight and related research and analysis, parliamentary development, capacity building and strategies for parliamentary institutional strengthening, public administration and capacity-building, parliamentary committees, Prior experience of a combination of all these areas is an advantage
  • Experience in project management, including in the design, budgeting, implementation and monitoring of projects, preferably related to budget and oversight and parliamentary or public administration affairs
  • Exposure to international parliamentary practices is an advantage

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Experience with parliamentary work related to budget including scrutiny of the budget and of public expenditures, understanding of budgetary and oversight tools and mechanisms available to parliament
  • Experience in budgetary related research, analysis and process. Experience in the process of formulation of the budget is an advantage
  • Experience in institutional and budget related support to public administration, the legislative sector and/or the private sector and in matters pertaining to budget regulatory frameworks, public accounts
  • Understanding of the oversight of public spending
  • Experience in cooperating with donors, international organisations, public administrations and civil society
  • Familiarity with gender budgeting concept, output based budgeting

item.title: Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist, MAHKOTA – Towards a Strong and Prosperous Indonesian Society
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
MAHKOTA Indonesia – Menuju Masyarakat Indonesia Yang Kokoh Sejahtera (Towards a Strong and Prosperous Indonesian Society) – aims to improve the quality and effectiveness of Indonesia’s poverty reduction programmes. It will support policy reform of existing social protection programmes and help Indonesia better reach and benefit the poorest as well as address key binding constraints to growth, competitiveness and rising inequality through ongoing labour market and social protection reforms. It will foster a wider range of policy debate in the country by supporting national think tanks and support the Indonesian Government in making important reforms towards social security.

Addressing the critical constraints to poverty reduction, economic growth and improved competitiveness goes beyond a single initiative. To reach these outcomes, MAHKOTA will work closely with other Australian development programmes including economic governance, education, health and women’s empowerment.

The Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist will support M&E for individual activities, as well as developing and reporting against the MAHKOTA M&E framework.

Applicants should be able to demonstrate the following:

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum 5-7 years of relevant professional experience, including 3 years in a long-term M&E position with an international donor-funded development project/organization;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in application of the logical framework approach, Performance Monitoring Plan development, and environmental assessment and impact monitoring;
  • Experience working in developing countries is required, preferably in the Asia-Pacific region. Experience of working in Indonesia will be an advantage.

EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences (International Development), Business Administration, Economics or other related fields;

SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:

  • Experience in participatory design (outcome mapping, after action review, structured interviews, focus groups, case studies, surveys, and secondary data analysis techniques);
  • Excellent command of survey design, data collection and data management, and data analysis using rigorous statistics and appropriate software;
  • Experience with economic development programs and gender mainstreaming.
  • Ability to explain M&E processes to staff and partners and ensure that they adhere to the highest standards of quality, relevance and timeliness in their M&E efforts;
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to write clear reports;
  • Ability to explain highly technical results to non-technical audiences;
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/011 MAHKOTA in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

She/He will need to establish and implement a strategic vision for MAHKOTA that is grounded in the political and institutional reality of Indonesia.

This includes:

  • Leading engagement with a wide range of stakeholders at the district, provincial and national level to support problem identification, planning and prioritisation of activities, and enthusiastically stimulate innovation and risk taking.
  • Managing a complex program of research, pilot and analytical activities that is implemented across a range of locations and focused on identifying affordable, local solutions to improving student learning.
  • Developing and implementing a stakeholder engagement and communications strategy that supports sharing of knowledge and findings generated by MAHKOTA and adaptability and replication of tested strategies.

Applicants should be able to demonstrate the following:

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • Ten years’ experience of working in development cooperation
  • 5 years’ experience as a Team Leader on similarly large and complex programs
  • Experience working in developing countries is required, preferably in the Asia-Pacific region. Experience of working in Indonesia will be an advantage.
